intro: Lasianthus stercorarius var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean stercorarius, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
